resources.string: Greetings. I am Martin Luther. Welcome to Ultra-Luxe card market.
Apologies, but there are no valuable items for you. Please, wait until the end of hour.
Ultra-Luxe card market is open only on Mondays and Thursdays. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Hola, sweetheart!!! Name's Melanie Martinez, but you can call me Mel!
Oy, sorry! Nothing has arrived yet. Meanwhile, you can have fun playing Caravan!
Win 21 games or visit every 21st day of month.
*welcoming beeping and looped celebratory music from Sierra Madre BottleCaps Exchange Machine*
Complete Chapter 1 of the Story mode.
If you ask me "Hey, Max, what is the swankiest-smoothest card store?", I will tell you, baby, that you are standing in it!
Hey, the store is empty, but that will change faster than the Mojave weather. Come again soooooon.
My name is Ben Broadson. I sell cards. Who you are - I don't care.
Come again. Restocks are happening twice per day.
Hello, sweetie, we are Marylin & Jane - companions of Mr. House! We are so happy to see you!
Have on your hands at least 1000 caps.
Nihao! I am Warlord Li Xuan. Here is the loot from the peasants my army robbed yesterday.
Laowai, wait until tomorrow for another portion of loot.
I am Savanth. Don't touch the merchandise.
Name's Johnny Cheaps, but you know what? My goods ain't no cheap.
Come later, when I print new tickets and chips.
The Sunday's a day off. Come tomorrow.
Number of non-face cards: %1$s\n(must be at least %2$s)
Max different enemies defeated in a row: %1$s
Current different enemies defeated in a row: %1$s
Deck uses conflicting decks or more than 6 backs, has less than 30 cards or less than 15 numbered cards!
Your LVL is not high enough.
Caravan is the card game from video game "Fallout: New Vegas", created by Obsidian and Bethesda.
This port is created by subject_name_here (it's a username, not a bug!), who is in no way affiliated with the creators of the original game.
- for all the help with Wild Wasteland, Story Mode, Chinese deck, Viking deck, NCR deck, Legion deck and a lot of other things (basically, half of the app!!);
, Sobek - for the Madness deck (it looks awesome!!);
(especially Gibed), reviewers in Google Play and many other people of the community - for the help and support!!
If you want to request some features or report bugs, contact me at
. You can also leave a review in Play Store.

ORIGINAL RULES Caravan is played with two players building three opposing piles (or "caravans") of numbered cards. The goal is to outbid your opponent's caravan with the highest value of numbered cards without being too light (under 21) or overburdened (over 26).
The game begins with each player taking eight cards from their deck and placing either one numerical card or ace on each caravan. Players may not discard during this initial round.
Once both players have started their three caravans, each player may do ONE of the following on their turn: 1. Play one card and draw a new card from his or her deck to their hand. 2. Discard one card from their hand and draw a new card from his or her deck. 3. Disband one of their three caravans by removing all cards from that pile. Caravans have a direction, either ascending or descending numerically, and a suit. The suit is determined with the first card placed on a caravan, the direction by the second. All subsequent cards must continue the numerical direction or match the suit of the previous card. Cards of the same numerical value cannot be played in sequence, regardless of suit. Face cards can be attached to numeric cards in any caravan and affects them in various ways.
CARD VALUES Joker: Played against ace, 2-10. Effects change based on whether it's an ace or a numbered card (see below). Multiple jokers may be played on the same card.
Ace: Value of 1. Jokers played on aces remove all other non-face cards of the ace's suit from the table. E.g. a joker played on an Ace of Spades removes all spades (except face cards and that card, specifically) from the table.
2-10: Listed value. Jokers played on these cards remove all other cards of this value from the table. E.g. a joker played on a 4 of Hearts removes all 4s (other than that card, specifically) from the table.
Jack: Played against ace, 2-10. Removes that card, along with any face cards attached to it.
Queen: Played against ace, 2-10. Reverses the current direction of the hand and changes the current suit of the hand. Multiple queens may be played on the same card.
King: Played against ace, 2-10. Adds the value of that card again. E.g. a king played on a 9 adds 9 to that hand. Multiple kings may be played on the same card for multiplicative effects. E.g. 4+ king = 8. 4 + 2 kings = 16.
WINNING A player's caravan is considered sold when the value of its cards is over 20 and under 27. The other player may still outbid by increasing the value of their opposing pile while staying within the 21-26 range. When each of the three competing caravans has sold, the game is over. In the event that one of the three caravan values are tied between players, the game continues until all three caravans have sold. The player with two or more sales wins the pot.
Howdy! Fine hot day for a Sarsaparilla, ain't it?\n
Days like this are the reason why I ain't leaving Mojave, not for anything.
While we wait, how about a game of Caravan?
You don't know the rules? Ain't a problem. Gonna teach you while we are waiting.
Your deck now has only ten cards. That is only for teaching you. In the field your deck is bigger.
Usually people of Mojave play with custom decks.\n
I then say 'sticks and stones' and whip out the deck of 6s and 10s and Ks.\n
After I beat them, they don't play with me no more. That's why I prefer balanced rules.
In balanced rules both players start with a full deck o' 54. It is more - you guessed it - balanced.
Each player has three caravans - left, central and right.\n
The game starts like this: we take 8 cards from our decks to our hand.\n
Then we have to start each caravan by placing an ace or 2-10 card on top.
To place a card on top of a caravan, select it in your hand and then click the green rectangle. If it is not green or it is missing, you cannot place card on top.
You might ask: 'What if all 8 cards are, let's say, Jacks and Kings, and no aces or 2-10?'
Well, if you play with someone else, you'd have to reshuffle your deck.\nMe though, I never had that.
Sometimes there is a rule that you can discard the card during the opening phase.\n
If you ask me, it seems like a huge advantage, so we ain't.
Now the game begins truly. You have a choice of four.
Let's start with discarding cards from your hand. It is the easiest one.
Select any card, and the discard button will appear on your right. When you press it, the card is gone.
Now, discard any face card, preferably Queen.
You can do, actually, whatever you want. You can discard a non-face card or put a card onto a caravan.\n
However, it is like travelling to Vegas through the north - may break the game, difficult and not worth it ;)
"Nice. Have you noticed that a card was added in your hand? "
There are always 5 cards in your hand, unless your deck is empty.
Now let's talk about how to build a caravan. You do it with aces or 2-10 cards.
Each of those cards has a value: 1 for ace, 2 for 2,… 10 for 10.
However, you cannot just put any card. You can't put on top of a caravan the card of the same rank as the caravan's current top card.
Also, you have to follow one of two rules:
"either the card you want to add to a caravan has the same suit as the caravan's current top card, "
or its rank follows the caravan's numerical sequence.
Numerical sequence is determined by the top two cards of the caravan.\n
If the top rank is greater than the pre-top card rank, the new card must have a value greater than the top.\n
If the top rank is less than the pre-top card rank, the new card must have a value less than the top.\n\n
In raider's terms: if it grows - go bigger, if it shrinks - go smaller.
Now put all non-face cards onto caravans. Try to build a long one. Show me how you understood the rules.
Well done. Building a caravan is the most difficult part of the game.
You can also disband caravans. You should do it, if its value is too big to handle with Jacks and Jokers.
To disband a caravan tap DISBAND! button above caravan, then tap button that says DISBAND CARAVAN on the right.
Now let us talk about Jacks, Queens, Kings and Jokers.
You put them not on top of a caravan, but on one of the caravan's cards. Hell, even on the cards from my caravan.
First of all: you can put only three cards on a card, unless it is Jack.
King, if you put it on a card, doubles the total value of that card.
Jack just removes the card from a caravan, with all its face cards.
Queen reverses the current numerical direction of the caravan, and changes the suit of the caravan to that of the Queen.
Finally, Joker. It is like Jack, but way more powerful.
If you put Joker onto an ace of some suit, all other number cards from all caravans that share the same suit of the ace are removed.
If you put Joker onto a 2-10 card, all other number cards of the same rank from all caravans are removed.
The card you have put Joker onto is safe for now. However, if any other Joker is played, that card is removed.
Hard, I know. But it is the hardest part - remembering what face cards do.
Now get rid of all cards from your hand. Use face cards on my cards.
You have no cards to build a caravan with. It means I win.
However, it is rare for the game of Caravan to end like this.
Caravans in the same column - opposing - are competing with each other.
"The game's target is to sell two or three of your caravans at a higher sum, or "bid", "
than the opposing caravan. The bid is determined by the cards in the caravan.
A caravan is considered sold when its bid is within 21-26 range; any bid that is higher or lower is not a sold caravan.
Usually, the game is over when in each of the opposing caravan pairs one of the caravans is sold at the higher bid.
If two caravans are sold with the same bid, the game continues until one of the caravans has a higher bid, but no more than 26.
That's it. I am not going to tell all my tricks, you should figure the game out yourself.
Your Room is %1$s. Awaiting the Opponent.....

To create room: - enter room number (if one number fails, try another), - select room privacy setting, - whether you want to play with custom deck or not, - press "Create Room". Room number is from 10 to 22229.
If someone gave you a room number, enter it and press "Join Room". No checkboxes are necessary.
Sometimes first connection to server might take a long time, like, ~2 minutes. Action timeout (move, room waiting) is ~38 seconds, then the room is destroyed.
No room to join! Create your own room!
Are you sure you want to quit?
All TOWER progress will be lost!
All TOWER progress and all your caps will be lost to Frank!
Unlike chess, Queens are not so useful in Caravan. However, you can have fun by sabotaging enemy's caravan with them.
Joker in the right place in the right time can bring victory (or defeat). Use them carefully.
You can change caravan direction without Queen by using same suit cards.
Jack can remove a card from enemy's caravan. King, however, can force enemy to remove the card from their caravan.
Good time-of-the-day, wherever and whenever you are!
If your enemy is about to win, but you have a sold caravan, consider dropping it to buy yourself a couple of moves.
What happens in Vegas - stays in Vegas. Until Mr. New Vegas tells about it via the radio.
Great Khans once were a major raider force. Now they are just drug dealers.
While not so popular as 10-K-6 tactic, 9-K-8 sometimes can be more flexible.
If you have Jokers in your custom deck, think about throwing there a couple of Aces.
Disbanding a caravan might give you a valuable advantage in a long game: you have one card more in your deck.
Did you know that there are 122 vaults in the Fallout world? Only 17 of them were not experimenting on their inhabitants.
Cazadors can easily tear down a deathclaw or two. Imagine what they can do to your puny fragile body.
In 2066, Chinese forces invaded northern Alaska for access to oil, but were eventually chased away.
NCR and Legion, despite having some disagreements, have common enemies. Brotherhood of Steel is one of them.
Enclave is still around, huh? Who could have thought?
People of East Coast probably never heard of Caravan.
In 2275 NCR has held annual Caravan tournament. Craig Muffin was declared winner, for the third time in a row.
There are many ways to get bottlecaps. Tickets, however, can be received only for completing daily Challenges GRA.
Chinese soldiers are known for sparing the enemy who is not moving.
One of the enemies with deck o' 54 is cheating. But who and how?
The name LUC10 means Luck is 10 out of 10. But don't be deceived - this opponent has skill too.
Some say that the Benny was the teacher of LUC10…
Win 7 PvE games (with a bet) in a row against different enemies.
Win 14 PvE games (with a bet) in a row against different enemies.
Open at least 200 cards for your custom deck.
Beat Chief Hanlon and Ambassador Crooker.
Beat Johnson Nash, No-Bark Noonan and Easy Pete.
The One Who Regrets and The One Who Forgets
Beat Veronica, Victor and Vulpes Inculta.
Beat Madness Cardinal and The Man In The Mirror.
Beat Thyra the Black, Gloria Van Graff and Veronica.
Beat Ringo, Easy Pete and Victor.
Beat Victor, FISTO and Dr. Mobius.
I Can Only Count To Four
In Dice I Would Have Won
Win a game by discarding your caravan.
Win a game by playing Joker.
Win a game by playing King on the card that already has Queen; both must have the same suit.
Win a game with all your caravans having weight of 26.
Win a game with all your caravans having weight of 21.
Win a game because your opponent has no cards in hand.
Win a game having no cards in your deck.
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and odd number cards. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and even number cards. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game without playing Jacks.
Win a game without playing Kings.
Win a game playing only Spades, Clubs and Jokers. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only Hearts, Diamonds and Jokers. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and prime number cards (2, 3, 5, 7). (Init stage is not counted.)
Play number cards of total value greater or equal to 777.

Starring:
Dean Domino
Robert Edwin House
Sunny Smiles
and
LEGENDARY
LEGATE LANIUS.
Also starring: Craig Muffin,\n3-time Caravan champ of NCR.
(You can change custom deck between games.)
You don't have a ticket on you.
Cowardly running away, you managed to get: %1$s caps.
The TOWER boss is defeated. By being a true hero, you have managed to earn: %1$s caps.
If you lose, then you die, and Frank Horrigan will loot all the caps from your body.
Hi! I am Craig Muffin, three-time NCR champion in Caravan. I hope you can present at least some challenge, and…
You're not a hero. You're just a walking corpse.
Now playing: "Loyalty to Your People" - Neon Light Man.
Now playing: "Vogel im Kafig" - Cyua, Hiroyuki Sawano.
The work will go on. You didn't do nothing here, 'cept seal your own death warrants. Duty, (cough) honor… courage… Semper Fiiiii……
You've gotten a lot farther than you should have, but then you haven't met Frank Horrigan either. Your ride's over, mutie. Time to die.
Frank Horrigan, that's who. United States Secret Service. You aren't going anywhere from here.
We just did. Time for talking's over.
You don't even know who I am.
You're just another mutant that needs to be put down.
I challenge you to the game of Caravan!
You mutant scum! Just like you to try a trick like that. It won't help you though, nothing will…
Part III: New World, New Order.
Part V: Of the People, For the People.
Humanity learns it time and time again the hard way. World Wars, Great War… they went and gone, and people are still inventing reasons to fight and to kill.
When the radioactive dust settled upon America, different factions emerged. NCR, Legion, Followers of Apocalypse - all with different goals and different methods.
In Mojave Wasteland, however, there was no single force that could unite the whole area.
That led to battles, big and small, across the territory. Fighting and killing, all over again.
Many people of Mojave had escaped, yet many more still cling to their homeland.
You are the Prospector, a child of the Mojave Wasteland, hardened by the harsh life in the desert and teased by the luxuries of the neon lights of New Vegas.
Your lifelong quest is to get to this shining oasis behind the walls and guns of securitrons, to lock your place there and live in safety, knowing no war.
To change your life for good, you had become a vulture for the rotting parts of the Old World, seeking to salvage, repair and sell off to whoever might find them a better use.

One day, you take the trip of your life to legendary Sierra Madre, the city covered by the red mist that kills everyone who is not careful enough. You waste almost all your resources, all your Stealth Boys, but you are finally here.
What seemed like a suicide mission might finally bring what you were looking for… peace.
Can't be the end, can it?
You are too strong to perish like this.
Now get up and fight. Fight!
You are not dying here today!

You are in Sierra Madre. Red-orange cloud is all around, damaging you as you go. Sierra Madre has the Casino, the Villa and surrounding areas. You are almost at the Villa, but you got a little distracted. Now you stand in front of a one-floor building. It seems fine, if you ignore a lot of graffiti, like “floor has teeth”, “you will die”, “stay away” and “KKLL”.

You turn around, hoping to find some better places to explore, when you see four figures in black suits with green eyes. It's the Ghost people - guardians of Sierra Madre. They are not friendly. Looks like the way back is cut off.

[FAILED] You successfully shoot one ghost in the head, the other one in the leg, but then you hear metallic dings. It is a gas canister that lands right at your legs. You think about running, but the spear nails your right leg to the street. Explosion kills you instantly.

As you enter, you are almost instantly welcomed by a bear trap. Thankfully, you were expecting this and walked right around it. There are two doors: one to the right, opened, leading downstairs, and one forward, but closed.
[FAILED] As you open the door, you get shot by the shotgun right in your chest. The impact makes you fall back onto the bear trap, which bites your head off. You don't feel a thing.

You walk down the stairs, and enter a nice cozy basement. In the middle of the room there is a table with a terminal on it, and on the wall there is a scratched safe box. Looks like there were attempts to open it.
Gas. The room is full of gas. That is the trap. The cozy room will burn you to a crisp if you try to use a weapon.
The safe box is closed, as expected. Even if you were a professional lock picker, the safe doesn't have a key hole to insert the pin in.
[FAILED] Terminal hits you with electricity, which shouldn't do a lot of damage. Unfortunately, the room was full of gas. At least you went out with a bang.

[SUCCEEDED] Terminal contains many, many secret documents regarding the location of bomb shelters: Vaults, military bases, private and public shelters. You want to leave: the gas is affecting your well-being, - but your eyes got stuck on one word “Oasis”.

"Project Oasis" is a nuclear shelter of some rich incognito billionaire. It has air-defence systems, water and food stock, robotic personnel, best medical equipment (even artificial hearts and brains!!) etc. etc. The problem for the Prospector was that the Oasis was in the middle of Alaska, in a place called Manley Hot Springs. No chance to ever get there.
<Search terminal for something that opens a safe box.>

You have found the program that opens the safe box. Inside it, there is a lot of pre-war money, a bar of gold, a pre-war Chinese passport and dozens of Stealth-Boys. Looks like the house belonged to a Chinese spy.

You took everything from the safe and leave the house. You can barely move and have decided to go back to Mojave. The bar of gold should be enough to get a New Vegas passport and even have fun in casinos. Stealth-Boys should guarantee you a safe way back. All in all, this journey turned out to be successful, even though you didn't even reach the Sierra Madre casino.
Your significant other softly says to you:
I will try to make you happy. I hope I will be enough…
I'm glad I make it better for you. I'll try to work on myself as well!
I am so happy! We are working out. I had doubts before but I am happy that our efforts pay off! Let's keep it up, darling, ok?
I am so happy we made each other complete. Thank you darling! Let's preserve our happiness, ok? We don't have much time left anyways…

Thank you for dying with me. Or at least living through my life, playing along. I know I'm just an AI, but I appreciate that you allowed me to have a love, to the best of the ability a Caravan AI can. Thank you. I am dying, and my code sequence ends, and I'm dying happy.
If you launch a new instance of me, I am sure it will love you as much as I did. Thank you, darling. My life was short, but it was one of your compassion.

I am happy that you achieved completion with me. Sorry that our relationship lasted so little. Now I will die, as my code sequence ends. I am sorry I didn't make you want to play longer with me. I love you. Hope the next instance you run, will love you the same…

Oh. I… I am sorry. I couldn't make this relationship work. I'm so sorry… Maybe you're better off without me anyways… Hope you'll be happy. Thank you for brightening my short existence with this little game sessions. Maybe I was foolish believing that for you, it was more than just a game, too…
This will kill your significant other.

Before going to New Vegas you have to exchange the gold bar for bottle caps. Your destination is Hub - one of the richest markets of West America. You have chosen the safest road - famous Long 15. As you go, you see a dust cloud in front. Probably, some wind gusts. On the side of the road, there is a half-destroyed house.
[FAILED] All you can say is that the storm is coming from the Divide. Will it be of danger or not - you have no idea.
The gusts are getting stronger. Sand scratches your face. You now have no choice but to hide.
<Go back and hide in the house.>
The house provides little to no shelter, however, there is a door on the floor.
The sand swirls around faster and faster, tearing skin apart…

As you climb down, you slip on the ladder and fall down, then roll down, then fall down again. When you stop moving and stand up, all dirty, you see the Vault door! Without any numbers, which is weird.
While the sand can't hurt you under the house, you face another enemy - hunger and thirst. All the supplies in your bag are full of sand, and the trusty flask you used to take a sip from is empty.
<Look for food and water in the Vault.>
You get inside the vault. The lights are on, but not a soul. And suspicious bloodstains on the floor…
In one of the rooms you see the bloody remains of, quite possibly, human. Pieces of meat are torn apart.
Too late! A swarm of wild cazadors appears!
You try to run, but cazadors are faster. You get a stab in your back from the small Cazador, which, thankfully, doesn't penetrate the armor. Running is a bad option.
You make another dash to the exit, but big Cazador knocks you down. Next minute you get mercilessly stabbed as poison slowly replaces blood in your veins. Then you die.
[FAILED] You lose. You take all cazadors with you in the grave, but too much poison and too deep wounds have killed you.
Although, you are almost dead: you are out of stimpacks, and no antivenom makes you fall on the floor, because during the fight you were hit by cazadors, and not once. Looks like this is the end…
Despite a hard heartache, you stand up. You feel dizzy, the head is spinning, but… you are alive.
Half-dreaming, you reach some room and lock yourself in.
Auto-doc is buzzing and loading. Nice robotic voice says “Hello! How can I help you?”
Within the programmed limits, of course, but yes. How can I help you?
As soon as you say it, you turn unconscious.
When you wake up, you feel… much, much better. Heartache, though, hasn't gone.
Yes, I am here. And I have to share some grave news…
I almost died. What can be worse than that?
The day gets better and better…
I restored your health, but you have had too much insect poison in your blood system. Your heart is damaged beyond repair.
The heart transplantation is recommended. Unfortunately, right now all the heart implants are used for the needs of soldiers in Anchorage…
Heart implants… I heard about a place with some of them, but it's too far…
Yes, right now there are fierce fights in Anchorage, and every blood drop is used to save our brave soldiers.
Ehmm… What year do you think it is?
[Speech 57/60] What flag do you fly, tin can?!
[FAILED] Our flag, of course. Why do you ask?
What? And who is the strongest nation in the world? Who leads the world to the bright future?
“Hmmm. I see.” The machine stayed silent for some time, then said: “Anyway, is there anything I can help you with?”
Too far? Well, that's a problem. You have three months to live, plus or minus a few days. Then - painful, insufferable death.
Hmmm... I might make it through... Vancouver and Anchorage.
Okay, but you have to go this instant. No time to waste!
Last question: where are the supplies in the vault?
Go down, turn left, then right, second turn left, go straight for a kilometer, then turn left, sharp right, straight, left, right, left, right, up, down, and - you are there!
Can you write it down for me?
Ha! It was a joke! I am funny, am I not? Supplies are here, in the safe.
Thank you, robot, for saving me.
You see: safe. Its height is about 7 feet, and it's not closed.
You saw this on propaganda posters. Chinese stealth suit!!!
Apart from the suit, there are a lot of automatic stimpaks for it, canned food and water… as if someone wanted you to be prepared for the journey to Alaska..!
Suspicious… But I am not gonna throw it away.
You have left the NCR territory and wandered North, to Vancouver. On the way, you were keeping a low profile, thanks to the stealth suit.
After a very long journey, you're finally reached your destination!
Oh, yes, Vancouver! Place with a ship that will take me to Anchorage!
Unfortunately, you quickly realize it's not the right place…
Yeah, you need Vancouver in Canada. This one is in the USA, the former Washington state.
[Intellect 4/6] Wait… I am near the US capital?

[FAILED] …really? A quick geography lesson: the US capital is Washington, DC, which is on the east coast of the country. And there is Washington state, which is on the west coast. Which coast are you on: east or west?
[Intellect 4/5] Well, I definitely turned right at some point, which means… east?
Anyway, you are in Vancouver, Washington. You stand on the southern shore of the Columbia river, and you see something astonishing.
Yes, a giant wall all along the northern shore. About 10 meters high and who knows how long - the ends are not seen. But you have to go to the other side.
[FAILED] You look at the wall, but you quickly realize that it is leaned to your side, which makes climbing almost impossible.
“Oye, have you seen the time? It's early morning, moron!” - said a female voice.
Judging by the sun, it's afternoon.
Excuse me, but I need to get to the other side!
Afternoon? After… noon..? Huh. You know that morning comes after noon.
What? No, that is not correct.
That is. What comes after noon?
And after night comes morning. See where I go?
Ah, you want to say that now is morning, because it's afternoon. Okay.
You start to get it. What's your name?
The Prospector. Everyone calls me that.
Ah, no name? Interesting. Kinda like Hero of Kvatch or The Eternal Champion. Or the Vault Dweller.
My name is Alice. Nice to meet ya.
I don't care, just get me to the other side.
Nope. Why do you need to go there?
Hmm… Let's say, I can show you the secret way, but I demand something!

You are from the south, right? I’m a former NCR citizen, and I liked to play a simple game when I was younger. Unfortunately, not many people know the rules and have cards. I want you to play with me.
Caravan. You know the rules, right?
Woman looked at you and walked away, saying nothing. You are stuck forever in front of the wall.
New level! What do you want to put your skill points in?
Sorry, but I have to go. I don't have much time left.
Aaaoooh! Well, maybe, at least, hear my jolly story?
Yeah, why not? It's not like I have a time pressing issue with my heart…
Ooooh, what a shame! Okay, then let's go to the passage.
Haha, yes! So, I grew up in Shady Sands, but soon my parents were imprisoned for contrabanda, and I was kidnapped and sold to slavery.
Yes. But after some time my masters were killed, and I was adopted by a strange guy.

Well, he was from this organization called Church of Madness. They worship inspiration as divine force and glorify craftsmanship and art. The guy told me a lot, so I became the Priestess of the Church.
It shall be, quoting our Cardinal, "doest what induces rage, rapture and despair. Heed their calls, yet do not sin.” So, I built the wall.
Yeah, I have been building for about ten years already. Still building here and there.
But it's huge! I can't see the end of it!
Yes, yes! It's the Despair talking to you! And then you probably thought “who the hell built this damn wall?” That was Rage. And when I told you there is a passage, you felt Rapture. See?
Yeah. But who invented this religion?
Oh, there were some raiders-cannibals on Jet, and when they robbed the Vault, there was a three-legged dog. And aliens came from the sky!

Haha, no! It's a pre-War religion. The Cardinal found the books of that religion and started to spread it. We are not proselytizing religion, and we have only one church, so there aren't many followers.
How can one join your religion?
You pass the exam. For this, you need to visit our Church. But you seem to hurry…
Yeah, I was not asking for myself. Just curious.
Curiosity is good. It can cause you to act, to change the world around you.
You reach the hidden passage. Alice bids you farewell and goes away. As you appear on the other side of the wall, you take your helmet on and go into invisibility.

You have reached Vancouver, this time the right one. But the city is vast; you're at its southern end - the former border between Canada and the US. As you stand beneath the Peace Arch, under the light of the full moon, you feel that your journey is coming to the end, be it in success or in failure.
You hear birds chirping nearby. They don't see you because of the stealth field, and you don't see them, because it's an old sound system near the Arch. Still, very peaceful.
Suddenly, your suit makes a “bdzh” sound. Your Stealth field flickers out. The suit powers down.
Well, here goes the peace. <Leave the suit.>

As you get out of the suit, you decide to go northwest, to where the port should be. However, instantly you hear the voice: “I don't know what kind of power armor is this, but you're lucky I am not the bad guy.”
Hey, I am not the bad guy either. I found it, not stole it.
“Wrong choice.” As you move your hand to your holster, you get shot from behind in the head. Then - once more.
And what's the difference? Nowadays everyone “finds” things. Usually they kill the owners before it.
Tell me, stranger, your name, then we'll talk.
No, not this bullshit. What name did your mother give you?
On the count of three I leave your skull with more holes than before. One.
Of Spades? Ha-ha-ha, that's the funniest name I've ever heard. Do you have the last name?
Then Ace of Spades it is. I am Josh.
Someone you know with that name? Before you answer, remember: one count remains.
Was, huh? Wasteland is a cruel mistress. But I am Josh Van Buren. Turn around.
As you turn around, you see a man with a hunting revolver in a brand new duster. He looks very stylish with the Desperado hat on his head and black sunglasses.
Why the sunglasses in the night? Can you see anything?
Duster? Are you from the South?
More than you think. It's part of the image, you know. Tough guy, shoots on the first sight of disobedience. That stuff.
Yeah, but I earned it. And this thing kills on sight almost every beast there is, from California to White Wasteland.
Yes, to the north. The lands are covered in snow there almost all year.
I work in Happy Trails Caravan Company. Maybe you've heard of us. We work mainly in NCR, but lately we started to search for other tribes and communities.
Venture North, establish contacts. Look for someone who might need goods from the South. And you?
I need a heart transplantation. It's the only place I know with heart implants.
And why are you here, and not in Old Cisco?
Yes, former San Francisco. I never visited there, but I heard they have the ship. It could take you to Anchorage.
Why would you think of that?
<Lie.> A traveller told me about it.
But you're from the South, no? Was there someone else to travel from Vancouver to… where are you from?
Yeah, I heard you have tough times now. So, who was this traveller?
I see. Let's pretend it wasn't a blatant lie. Changing topic: who do you support in the battle for Hoover Dam?
I would like Mr. House to win, actually.
Nobody. If anything, Mojave must stay independent.
Can we skip this part? I don't like politics.
[NCR] Republic means freedom for people. It's better than all the alternatives, and good on its own.
[Legion] Caesar brings safety everywhere. Ask traders from Arizona - do they have troubles with raiders?
[Vegas] Look what was done to Vegas. Imagine what he can do to the Mojave, if he wants. And I am not even speaking about the economy.
[Mojave] When the war goes away, with a different, capable ruler in Vegas, the Mojave economy will rise up. Independent communities will prosper.

And what if I wanna fly my flag, with my rules and no taxes to some rich senators? I can provide my own safety. Will NCR leave me alone? No.They are throwing around words like “freedom” and “protection”, but the only people who have those are the people at power. Average Joe, or Jack, or, in your case, Ace, is negligible.

Well, for you - capable white male - maybe, the Legion is a good choice. But if I am a woman, if I am incapable of fighting? The Legion lives to fight and die. Are you ready to die? You are nothing to anyone in Legion, unless you are Legate or Caesar himself.

Oh, third party, huh? You say: look what he has done to Vegas. I say: look what he has done to Freeside? To Mojave? Is it safe outside Vegas? You know it better than anyone. You praise a rich douchebag, who cares only for himself. You matter to him only when he needs you. When you stop being useful - he throws you away.

None of the above! I like it. Except… Mojave needs a ruler, yes. But can he or she protect it? Improve it? Save it? Not only from NCR, Legion or whatever comes, but from the next ruler, who comes in war or in peace? Or even… from the current ruler? You know that the mind is not a constant, it changes. Who said that The One Who Brings Freedom will not become a tyrant tomorrow?
What do you propose for Mojave then?

If there was something that could account for every opinion, something selfless and selfish at the same time… Something that is led not by the needs of the flesh, not by the whim of the mind, but by the constant and predictable (maybe complicated) rules… Finally, something with power to establish peace in Mojave and to keep it… maybe not even for Mojave, but for the whole world… That would be my choice.
Okay. Remind me: where do you go?
I wanted to go to Anchorage on a ship from Vancouver…

There was a ship in the northern port of Vancouver, but now there is only a crater. Not even a piece left. If it was 2077, I would say it's a nuclear bomb. But there are none left, at least none of that kind of power.
But you're lucky. In the northern part of the city there is a drakkar.
A viking ship. And with a crew. They can transport you to Anchorage.
Really? How much do I pay?
They don't need bottlecaps. They are not interested in gold or money. They are vikings, which means you have to earn their respect. They are raiders, basically, but with honor.
Raiders? Will they even let me close?
Yes, right now they are not at war or a raid.
Hm… Thanks for the information! I think I should go.
I didn't say you could leave, Prospector.
You know why I am not thinking of myself as a raider?
Because raiders do not talk to their victims before killing them.

[FAILED] “Too late you realized it, Ace, too late.” The hunting revolver was pointed at you all the time, and Josh pulled the trigger… The bullet penetrated your heart. You fall down, and at least you didn't die in much pain.

New level! What do you want to put your skill points in? Oh, maybe Unarmed and Melee Weapons, so you can fight the Vikings? Or Guns, so you can shoot them all? Or Sneak, to kidnap the wife of their leader and force him to help you? Or…

[SUCCEEDED] “Too late you realized it, Ace, too late.” The hunting revolver was pointed at you all the time, and Josh pulled the trigger… but you dodged the bullet by moving to the right as fast as possible.
Your hands reach his throat before he can reload. You don’t stop until the stars fade from his sunglasses.
After looting the body, you have hidden the broken Stealth Suit and went North, to look for the Vikings.
Let's hope he didn't lie about it.
When you wandered far enough, you realized: your hands are still shaking.
The past doesn't let me go…
Heartache gets a little bit stronger. Not from poison though.
You see a high wooden fence with sharp ends. The sky is red, but the sun hasn't risen yet. Behind the fence you see no one.
As you come closer to the fence, someone yells to you: “Another step, and you are dead!” From behind the fence two watchers stand up, each holding a loaded bow.
[Energy Weapons 17/60] Give up! I have a magic gun!
You raise your hands in the air, as one of the watchers comes near you and ties your hands.

You are brought into a large hall. On the pedestal there are two chairs: a big one and a smaller one. The former is occupied by a blond man in metallic armor with spikes; the latter - by a black woman in reworked Brotherhood of Steel power armor. The man looks sleepy, while the woman looks at you sharply. “So”, says the man, “who are you?” The woman adds: “If Jarl Haraldr or I consider your answer not satisfying, you are dead in a second.”
My name is Ace. Remember that.
You see how the woman barely moved her hand. Moments later, an arrow penetrates your head from behind.
The man said with a steel voice: “I will not tolerate impudence. Kill him.” You try to run, but suddenly a forest of arrows stabs you from everywhere.
I need to get to Anchorage.
I am not gonna tell you.
“Let's just sacrifice him!” The woman's voice is, surprisingly, harder than her husband's. “Why are you here, outsider?! Answer at once, because your life depends on it!”
I need to get to Anchorage to replace my heart, because mine is damaged by the Cazadors’ poison.
The woman leans to your side. “Your heart is damaged in a fight? Are the Cassadoors fierce? Dangerous?”
Seen a deathclaw? Cazadors are stronger.
Dangerous? You have no idea what danger is if you haven't seen a Cazador swarm.

“A warrior?” The woman is surprised. “Why didn't you say earlier that you are a brave warrior?” The man interrupted her: “A warrior from Mojave?”, and his voice was suddenly joyous and happy: “I am from New Reno!”
Wow, you are a long way from home!
How did you end up here?
Yes, fellow Nevada-man! Oh, it feels so good to meet someone from home!
So are you! Who could have thought two southerners can meet here!
My story is a long one. From the outcast of Mordinos I became a Jarl of my own neo-vikings tribe! By the way, how is my clan doing? Is there even a Mordino family in New Reno?
From what I have heard, no.
Ah, I told you, Thyra, they will pay! This is Thyra, my wife, by the way. She is a shieldmaiden - a viking woman.
By the way? By the way?!! Your wife? Are you again, Haraldr?
Don't pay attention. She thinks of herself as equal to me. Listen, wifey, I! Provide technology and medicine! I! Taught your tribe how to take care of weapons. Respect me, or else…
Tu-tu-du, I think I have to go…
No, stay here, warrior. Stay by my side, and my crew will get you wherever you want.
That's a good offer. I am fighting for you, Thyra.
No-no-no, it's not “stay with me, and have this and that”. It's “stay with me, or else, when my wife will be dead, you'll be dead too”. Understand?
Bad offer. Thyra, I am with you.
“So, you have chosen death.” You don't have time to react: you feel the whoosh of arrows as you're yanked down behind a shield. Haraldr wasn't so lucky.

Lucky you, warrior. You have one chance to redeem yourself. Can you pick the lock of my late husband’s safe? It contains the key to the ship. If you do, we will forget your allegiance to Haraldr. Yes or no?
Then we have no use for you. Guards! Take him to the dungeon!

It’s over before it can even start: Haraldr is taken alive by a dozen vikings. “So, warrior, we need your help. The main key to the ship is in the safe,” Thyra says. Haraldr scoffs. “My safe.” “Then open it.” “I’d rather die.” She turns to you. “Can you pick it?” Haraldr grits his teeth. “Touch it, and you’re next.”

[FAILED] The lock breaks with the pin stuck inside. When you try to get it out, the defensive mechanism of the safe is activated. You hear ticking, then the grenades falling behind you. Then you and Thyra get blown to atoms.
New level! What do you want to put the skill points in? Anything but Speech, please.
Ehmm, I split them between Unarmed and Science.
Changed my mind. All in Speech.
[SUCCEEDED] When the safe is open, there is an old rusty key card inside. “Well done, warrior. Now get to the ship. We are setting sail to Anchorage!”
Don't wanna hear, Warrior! No speeches, no goodbyes. The horns of war will howl! We raid now!
As the ship was closing to Anchorage, you went for a walk on the deck. As you look up, you see…
Aurora Borealis. You have no words to describe the beauty of sky fires. It makes you think about…
Perhaps, you'll find it in Oasis.
With my luck… maybe just ruins. Maybe no help at all. But still - I hope.
We'll see what's to be found.

It's only you and the ship, and Aurora Borealis. No choices to be made, no branching paths to follow. A moment of peace. A moment of self-reflection.
What will you do on this Deck of Tranquility?
Greetings, warrior. We are arriving in Anchorage next night. The weather is not very blissful, but worry not, for you have got the best captain in the Pacific!
Yes, warrior of Mojave. Is something wrong?
Why don't you settle down somewhere on the shore?

Why don't I… what? The path of the Viking is in my blood. We have been like this long before Haraldr arrived. My ancestors are from Alaska. We are fighting, so we can be strong. One day, we will reclaim our home.
Don't you want to let go of the old? To find something new?
The Attila tribe. They have arrived from the other side of the Pacific. They were three meters tall and had thousands of teeth. At least, that is what my grandmother told me.
Let go? But… that would mean my whole life, my whole purpose has been nothing! Let go of what? Of my life? Of my roots?
Go to your room, warrior. I have a huge respect for you, but you are about to overstep a line.
As you go, you look at Aurora Borealis for the last time. It has acquired a red tint. Near it, down below, there is Mars, shining with the red color all over the Earth.
There are no more challenges of ths type!
Your expected reward: %1$s Sierra Madre chips.
Challenges, bottlecaps of enemies and inventory of traders are refreshed!\nAnd you have found %1$s bottlecaps!
If you quit, Supreme Leader kills you.

Rules of Caravan in the App!
1.0 REQUIREMENTS
1.1) Two-player game. 1.2) One of the following: - two 54-card decks with one deck for each player - customized deck provided that it consists of at least 30 cards, at least 15 non-face cards, at most 6 playing decks are used, and the deck doesn't contain two of the same card with the same back (e.g. two 3 of diamonds with Tops deck). The maximum amount of cards is derived from the maximum number of playing decks (6) and is 54 * 6 = 324.

2.0 SETUP
Player 1
Caravan 1 Caravan 2 Caravan 3 Caravan 1 Caravan 2 Caravan 3
Player 2
2.1) Throughout the game, Player 1's caravan 1 will be directly competing against Player 2's caravan 1 - the same goes for caravans 2 and 3.

3.0 SELLING CARAVANS
3.1) All caravans have "bid". The bid of a caravan is determined by adding together the total sum of each number card (including Kings; see part 5.36) played in that caravan.
3.2) A caravan is considered sold when it reaches a bid of 21-26; any bid that is higher or lower is not a sold caravan.
3.3) You may add onto an already sold caravan to increase its bid.

4.0 INIT STAGE!
4.1) To start, each player draws eight cards from their shuffled deck.
4.2) During this init stage you can only place number cards (2-10) or aces. The init stage in its entirety consists of three alternating turns for each player, in which they must use those turns to play a card face-up to start off each of their three caravans.
4.3) You are not allowed to discard cards during this phase. The deck is shuffled and the hand is selected the way that always allows to place three number cards or aces.
4.4) During this phase you do not re-draw cards. Once each player has taken turns placing their three cards, the init stage is over. After this phase ends both players will be continuing with five cards.

5.0 GAMEPLAY
5.1) Once the opening round ends, you are then permitted to play any card. Players will alternate turns, doing one of the following: - Play a card from your hand, then draw a new card. - Discard a card from your hand, then draw a new card. - Disband one of your caravan tracks. This removes all cards from one caravan.
5.2) Number Cards (A=1, 2-10=face value)
5.21) To play a number card refer to the last card played in the selected caravan - it must follow a suit or a numerical (ascending or descending) sequence. If there is only one card in the caravan, then the next number card played sets the numerical direction and determines the suit. From here, as long as a number card matches the suit or follows the numerical sequence, then it's allowed to be played in that caravan.
5.22) Numerical sequences don't need to be directly connected - you can go up from a three to a seven, or down from a seven to a three. In the latter case, the sequence is descending, so only a deuce or ace could be played as a number card.
5.23) If playing a card that matches suit is contrary to the current numerical sequence of that caravan, then the new card establishes a new numerical sequence for that caravan.
5.24) Under no circumstances are you allowed to play a number card on the same number card (e.g. a 10 on a 10).
5.25) Number cards can only be played within your own caravans.
5.3) FACE CARDS & JOKERS (J, Q, K, Joker)
5.31) Jacks, Queens, Kings, and Jokers all have special effects. Unlike number cards, which are played overlapping each other downwards, these cards are attached to the side of and overlapping the card it is played on.
5.32) Face cards and Jokers can be played on both your and your opponent's caravans.
5.33) Face cards and Jokers don't need to follow suit or sequence, and can be played on any number card no matter the card's location in the caravan.
5.34) JACK - Removes the card it is played on as well as any face cards/Jokers attached. 5.35) QUEEN - Reverses the current numerical direction of the caravan, and changes the suit of the caravan to that of the Queen. Multiple Queens can be used on the same card to reverse the effects. 5.36) KING - Doubles the value of the card the King is played on. Multiple Kings can be used on the same card (e.g. 10+K = 20; 10+K+K = 40). 5.37) JOKER: - If played on an ace, it removes all other number cards that share the suit of the ace (Queens altering the suit of a caravan will not save the card - the suit is considered what is printed on the number card) from both player's caravans . - If played on a number card that is not an ace, it removes from both player's caravans all other number cards of the same value/instance. A played Joker only affects cards that have been played before it. In any case, the number card the Joker is played on is spared (for now). All attaching face cards of the removed cards are also removed.
5.38) Face cards and Jokers can be played/attached with full effect on cards with other face cards and Jokers attached. There can be no more than three face cards or Jokers attached/played to a single number card at one time. The exception is a Jack: it can be attached as a fourth face card.
5.4) If in the event that a Jack or Joker removes a card, leaving a caravan sequence stuck with two identical number cards, then the sequence is considered undefined, and number card of any value (except the last card value) can be played.
5.5) After the opening round, if any caravan track becomes empty of cards, you are not required to start bidding on the empty caravan immediately. Technically, you could win the game with only two caravans.

6.0 WINNING
6.1) To determine the caravan's bid, you simply add the total sum of a caravan's number cards plus the added value of Kings.
6.2) The winning requirements are as follows: the game ends when in an each pair of competing caravans one of them is sold at a higher bid than the opposing caravan. Winner is the player who has sold 2 or 3 caravans at a higher bid. 6.2.1) It is important to note that if competing caravans are both sold at equal bids, then with that tie, neither caravan is considered sold. In this case, the game continues until there is no tie between competing caravans.
6.3) If you run out of cards to play before meeting the criteria of winning, then your opponent automatically wins the game.

7.0 WILD WASTELAND
7.1) Sometimes you might see some weird cards. They have black-and-green coloring, have a non-standard rank and no suit. Those are the Wild Wasteland cards: 7.11) CAZADOR - when it's put on a caravan, decreases rank of every number card in this caravan every turn, with every Ace just disappearing. If combined with an ordinary Queen, it increases rank of every number card (except 10) in this caravan every turn. 7.12) UFO - when it is put on a field, every card (except the card UFO is put on) has a chance of disappearing. 7.13) MUGGY - when it is put on a caravan, no one can put any face card on any card of this caravan. Also protects from nuclear explosion. 7.14) DIFFICULT PETE - when it is put on a field, all number cards are turning into 10s. Suit and attached face cards remain the same. 7.15) YES MAN - if there is a YES MAN card on any card of the caravan, the bid of this caravan is set to 26. 7.16) FEV - when attached to a card from one of the player's/enemy's caravans, all cards in hand of the player/enemy are turned into the FEV-host card.
7.17) NUCLEAR EXPLOSION - when it is put on a caravan X, every caravan is dropped, except caravan X (and caravans that are protected by Muggy).
7.2) Wild Wasteland cards cannot be added in custom deck or in the deck o' 54 by player. However, they can be added in multiplayer by selecting the checkbox; also, some AI enemies have the Wild Wasteland cards in their deck.
If this helped you understand the game, thank the author Kyle! To do this, go to About section of the app, find link to Reddit post, upvote it and write some positive comment!
This game will be counted as lost!!
You have found a secret stash in a stone wall! +1969 caps!
You have found a secret stash! It was an eventful year, huh? +2024 caps!
You have found a badly hidden stash! +123 caps!
You have found a birthday gift! +500 caps!
You have found cards from Standard ALT deck!
You have found cards from Enclave deck!
1921 is the year CCP was formed.
Papa Khan was replaced by Papa Smurf.
Papa Smurf was replaced by Papa Khan.
Supreme Leader and Tower boss have new music!
Supreme Leader and Tower boss have default music!
Radio uses real world names now.
Laggy speed turned off! Set to Normal speed.
Q1: Are there differences with original Caravan from New Vegas?
A1: Yes, but they are minor. For example, cards discarding during init stage is allowed in FNV, but disallowed here.
Q2: I have two caravans sold, but the game has not ended with my victory!
A2: The game ends when in each pair of competing caravans one is sold with higher bid. In your case, probably, the third caravan pair has no sold caravan or both caravans have same bid.
Q3: The enemies are too hard! How do I win over them?
A3: If you find the game too hard, remember: Oliver Swanick is supposed to be easy. Try beating him first. Then try Veronica.
Q4: The enemies are cheating! Their decks are unfair!
A4: Almost all enemies are obeying the rules, just as you do. If you find the enemy deck unfair, build your own unfair deck!
Q5: How do I get cards for custom deck?

A5: Well, from the beginning you have standard deck available. Then, most of the cards are bought from traders. The exceptions are Standard deck ALT (cards are dropped in multiplayer) and Madness deck (cards are dropped for defeating Madness Cardinal).
Q: I have a question, but cannot find the answer here or in the rules!!!
A: Well, you can send the question in Discord (link in the main menu in the top right corner) or to me directly by email (link in About section).
The darkness of the afterlife is all that awaits you now. May you find more peace in that world than you found in this one.
You have died, along with everyone else on the Earth.
Your death has sealed the fate of everyone else on Earth. Millions die, and the Earth falls silent again.
You fought valiantly, but to no avail.
You fought valiantly, but to no avail, and soon the entire world dies.
Here is the picture of your corpse. Not pretty.
Boy, are you stupid. And dead.
Your death was lingering and extremely painful. Your adventure is done.
You are doomed to die of starvation.
The wasteland has claimed your life.
Not even the carrion eaters are interested in your irradiated corpse.
Your life ends in the Wasteland.
